intro: Hieracium manotrichum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant features soft, woolly hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or reddish, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Hieracium manotrichum thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
